content: Make sure to allow cookies in Thunderbird prior to setting up the account. Don't use a VPN when setting up the account. Turn off your anti-virus real-time scanner prior to setting up the account.
creator: christ1

content:
Hey Christ,

I have cookies enabled, I use a vpn but I used a vpn last time I used thunderbird (last week with my other account) and had no issues. I have antivirus off also.

Anything else you would recommend?
creator: hitmanjammer

content: Instead of arguing, why don't you try without a VPN?
creator: christ1

content:
Antivirus software is McAfee Premium

McAfee may well be the problem.

Try to start Windows 10 in safe mode with networking enabled.

Does the problem go away?

Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software. This is a troubleshooting step, not a solution.
creator: christ1

content: If you are seeking assistance, you need to explain your problem and provide some details. Thank you.

content: If it is a regular password, not an 'app' password, do this' - settings>privacy&security - click saved passwords and then show passwords. you may be prompted for your Windows signin code first.
